info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 26 at 1:43PM EDT until August 26 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Northeastern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Rensselaer County in east central New York... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 142 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chatham, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Chatham, Nassau, Claverack, Lee, Lenox, Stephentown, New Lebanon, Valatie, Becket, Austerlitz, Philmont, Kinderhook, Hancock, Claverack-Red Mills, Housatonic, Berkshire, Dalton, Ghent and Lanesborough. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
